before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"diqr4","text":"Ensure that the cellular reagent (OpenVent enzyme) to be used is available and has been pre-tested for functionality.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"facim","text":"Ensure that all the other components needed to prepare the PCR mix are available and free from contaminants..","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"eaku0","text":"This protocol documents the production of BenBio 1X PCR Master Mix \"Wet\" and \"Dry\" formulations including the different colors of the Wet formulations (Rubis or oink and Saphir or blue). This method uses  OpenVent cellular reagents. The PCR master mixes are then stored for subsequent PCR reactions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"birsu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50nkn","text":"Cellular reagents are defined as common molecular biology enzymes expressed in E.coli but not subsequently purified before use i.e. dried E.coli cells are used as the reagent (Bhadra et al (2018)). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cc0t8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vg7p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"auuif","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"42kgt","text":"This protocol describes the steps in preparing and testing the functionality of 1X PCR master mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Preparing 1x PCR Master mix, 1x PCR Master mix formulation

the beaker to dissolve the powder.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"erv1t","text":"Filter the trehalose stock solution obtained through a 0.22 uM syringe filter in a sterile 15 mL eppendorf tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4tbe","text":"Store at 4 °C for months.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dbi8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r24p","text":" tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":37,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dnok0","text":"From a 20 % trehalose stock, aliquot some volume into the Eppendorf tube to dissolve the dye powder, to make a 10 mL (dye) solution.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"607k3","text":"Cork tightly the eppendorf tube and mix the content gently to homogenize title: Preparing 1x PCR Master Mix
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ortu","text":"Wear protective clothing like Lab coats, with gloves and face masks during the process and avoid dust formation from any powders.
